# packages/adapter-rust/vendor/codelldb/linux-arm64/lldb/lib/python3.12/site-packages/pip/_vendor/rich/box.py

@generated: 2026-02-09T18:01:03Z

## Core Purpose
Defines box-drawing character sets for rendering table borders and frames in terminal interfaces. Part of the Rich library's table/console rendering system.

## Key Components

### Box Class (L16-189)
Primary class that encapsulates a complete set of box-drawing characters for all table parts (top, head, rows, foot, bottom). Initialized with an 8-line string template where each line defines characters for different table sections.

Key methods:
- `__init__(box: str, *, ascii: bool = False)` (L33): Parses 8-line box template into individual character attributes
- `substitute(options: ConsoleOptions, safe: bool = True)` (L73): Returns alternative box based on platform constraints (legacy Windows, ASCII-only)
- `get_plain_headed_box()` (L91): Returns equivalent box without special header characters
- `get_top(widths: Iterable[int])` (L101): Generates top border string for given column widths
- `get_row(widths, level, edge)` (L121): Generates horizontal separator for different table sections ("head", "row", "foot", "mid")
- `get_bottom(widths: Iterable[int])` (L170): Generates bottom border string

### Predefined Box Constants (L192-407)
Collection of 20+ predefined Box instances covering various styles:
- ASCII variants: `ASCII`, `ASCII2`, `ASCII_DOUBLE_HEAD` (L192-226)
- Unicode box-drawing: `SQUARE`, `MINIMAL`, `ROUNDED`, `HEAVY`, `DOUBLE` (L228-395)
- Minimal styles: `SIMPLE`, `HORIZONTALS` (L285-329)
- Special format: `MARKDOWN` (L397-407)

### Substitution Maps (L410-427)
- `LEGACY_WINDOWS_SUBSTITUTIONS`: Maps problematic Unicode boxes to safe alternatives for legacy Windows
- `PLAIN_HEADED_SUBSTITUTIONS`: Maps boxes with special header styling to plain equivalents

## Dependencies
- `._loop.loop_last`: Utility for iterating with last-item detection
- `typing` extensions for Python <3.8 compatibility
- `ConsoleOptions` from rich.console (type checking only)

## Architecture Notes
- Box template format: 8 lines Ã— 4 characters representing all border/intersection combinations
- Character mapping follows consistent pattern: left, horizontal/fill, cross/vertical, right
- Platform-aware rendering with fallbacks for terminal limitations
- Immutable design - substitution methods return new Box instances

## Demo Script (L430-479)
Interactive demonstration that renders all box styles in a grid layout using Rich's Table and Console components.
